newsitem.title: USA: ComEd to boost nuclear budget, address NRC.
newsitem.headline: ComEd to boost nuclear budget, address NRC.

text.p: Unicom Corp's Commonwealth Edison Co on Wednesday responded to Nuclear Regulatory Commission concerns and said it will increase its 1997 nuclear operating and maintenance budget by 11 percent.
ComEd said in a statement it will begin immediately to prepare a detailed response to the NRC's directive.
Earlier, the NRC added five nuclear facilities to its watch list of eight problem facilities, including two operated by ComEd. One of ComEd's facilities was already on the list.

"Our plants are safe to operate," James O'Connor, chairman and chief executive of ComEd, said in a statement. He said the company's highest priority continues to be safe and successful operation of the facilities.
O'Connor said activities underway include improvements in operating and personnel procedures and the repair and replacement of equipment.
